books.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III

chapters.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 1

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 1:1
verses.text: Treatises of Cyprian Book : Cyprian to his son Quirinus, greeting.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 1:2
verses.text: Of your faith and devotion which you manifest to the Lord God, beloved son, you asked me to gather out for your instruction from the Holy Scriptures some heads bearing upon the religious teaching of our school; seeking for a succinct course of sacred reading, so that your mind, surrendered to God, might not be wearied with long or numerous volumes of books, but, instructed with a summary of heavenly precepts, might have a wholesome and large compendium for nourishing its memory.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 1:3
verses.text: And because I owe you a plentiful and loving obedience, I have done what you wished.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 1:4
verses.text: I have laboured for once, that you might not always labour.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 1:5
verses.text: Therefore, as much as my small ability could embrace, I have collected certain precepts of the Lord, and divine teachings, which may be easy and useful to the readers, in that a few things digested into a short space are both quickly read through, and are frequently repeated.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 1:6
verses.text: I bid you, beloved son, ever heartily farewell.

chapters.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 2

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 2:1
verses.text: Of the benefit of good works and mercy.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 2:2
verses.text: In Isaiah: "Cry aloud," saith He, "and spare not; lift up thy voice like a trumpet; tell my people their sins, and the house of Jacob their wickednesses.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 2:3
verses.text: They seek me from day to day, and desire to know my ways, as a people which did righteousness, and did not forsake the judgment of God.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 2:4
verses.text: They ask of me now a righteous judgment, and desire to approach to God, saying, What! because we have fasted, and Thou hast not seen: we have humiliated our souls, and Thou hast not known.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 2:5
verses.text: For in the days of fasting are found your own wills; for either ye torment those who are subjected to you, or ye fast for strifes and judgments, or ye strike your neighbours with fists.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 2:6
verses.text: For what do you fast unto me, that to-day your voice should be heard in clamour? This fast I have not chosen, save that a man should humble his soul.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 2:7
verses.text: And if thou shalt bend thy neck like a ring, and spread under thee sackcloth and ashes, neither thus shall it be called an acceptable fast.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 2:8
verses.text: Not such a fast have I chosen, saith the Lord; but loose every knot of unrighteousness, let go the chokings of impotent engagements.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 2:9
verses.text: Send away the harassed into rest, and scatter every unrighteous contract.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 2:10
verses.text: Break thy bread to the hungry, and bring the houseless poor into thy dwelling.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 2:11
verses.text: If thou seest the naked, clothe him; and despise not them of thy own seed in thy house.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 2:12
verses.text: Then shall thy seasonable light break forth, and thy garments shall quickly arise; and righteousness shall go before thee: and the glory of God shall surround thee.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 2:13
verses.text: Then thou shalt cry out, and God shall hear thee; while thou art yet speaking, He shall say, Here I am".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 2:14
verses.text: Concerning this same thing in Job: "I have preserved the needy from the hand of the mighty; and I have helped the orphan, to whom there was no helper.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 2:15
verses.text: The mouth of the widow blessed me, since I was the eye of the blind; I was also the foot of the lame, and the father of the weak".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 2:16
verses.text: Of this same matter in Tobit: "And I said to Tobias, My son, go and bring whatever poor man thou shalt find out of our brethren, who still has God in mind with his whole heart.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 2:17
verses.text: Bring him hither, and he shall eat my dinner together with me.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 2:18
verses.text: Behold, I attend thee, my son, until thou come".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 2:19
verses.text: Also in the same place: "All the days of thy life, my son, keep God in mind, and transgress not His precepts.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 2:20
verses.text: Do justice all the days of thy life, and do not walk in the way of unrighteousness; because if thou act truly, there will be respect of thy works.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 2:21
verses.text: Give alms of thy substance, and turn not thy face from any poor man.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 2:22
verses.text: So shall it come to pass that the face of God shall not be turned away from thee.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 2:23
verses.text: Even as thou hast, my son, so do: if thou hast abundant substance, give the more alms therefrom; if thou hast little, communicate even of that little.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 2:24
verses.text: And do not fear when thou givest alms: thou layest up for thyself a good reward against the day of need; because alms delivereth from death, and does not suffer to go into darkness.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 2:25
verses.text: Alms is a good office for all who do it in the sight of the most high God".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 2:26
verses.text: On this same subject in Solomon in Proverbs: "He that hath pity on the poor lendeth unto the Lord".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 2:27
verses.text: Also in the same place: "He that giveth to the poor shall never want; but he who turns away his eye shall be in much penury".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 2:28
verses.text: Also in the same place: "Sins are purged away by alms-giving and faith".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 2:29
verses.text: Again, in the same place: "If thine enemy hunger, feed him; and if he thirst, give him to drink: for by doing this thou shalt scatter live coals upon his head".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 2:30
verses.text: Again, in the same place: "As water extinguishes fire, so alms-giving extinguishes sin".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 2:31
verses.text: In the same in Proverbs: "Say not, Go away, and return, to-morrow I will give; when you can do good immediately.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 2:32
verses.text: For thou knowest not what may happen on the coming day".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 2:33
verses.text: Also in the same place: "He who stoppeth his ears that he may not hear the weak, shall himself call upon God, and there shall be none to hear him".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 2:34
verses.text: Also in the same place: "He who has his conversation without reproach in righteousness, leaves blessed children".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 2:35
verses.text: In the same in Ecclesiasticus: "My son, if thou hast, do good by thyself, and present worthy offerings to God; remember that death delayeth not".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 2:36
verses.text: Also in the same place: "Shut up alms in the heart of the poor, and this will entreat for thee from all evil".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 2:37
verses.text: Concerning this thing in the thirty-sixth Psalm, that mercy is beneficial also to one's posterity: "I have been young, and I have also grown old; and I have not seen the righteous forsaken, nor his seed begging their bread.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 2:38
verses.text: The whole day he is merciful, and lendeth; and his seed is in blessing".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 2:39
verses.text: Of this same thing in the fortieth Psalm: "Blessed is he who considereth over the poor and needy: in the evil day God will deliver him".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 2:40
verses.text: Also in the cxith Psalm: "He hath distributed, he hath given to the poor; his righteousness shall remain from generation to generation".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 2:41
verses.text: Of this same thing in Hosea: "I desire mercy rather than sacrifice, and the knowledge of God more than whole burnt-offerings".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 2:42
verses.text: Of this same thing also in the Gospel according to Matthew: "Blessed are they who hunger and thirst after righteousness: for they shall be satisfied".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 2:43
verses.text: Also in the same place: "Blessed are the merciful: for they shall obtain mercy".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 2:44
verses.text: Also in the same place: "Lay up for yourselves treasures in heaven, where neither moth nor rust doth corrupt, and where thieves do not dig through and steal: for where your treasure is, there will your heart be also".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 2:45
verses.text: Also in the same place: "The kingdom of heaven is like unto a merchantman seeking goodly pearls: and when he hath found a precious pearl, he went away and sold all that he had, and bought it".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 2:46
verses.text: That even a small work is of advantage, also in the same place: "And whoever shall give to drink to one of the least of these a cup of cold water in the name of a disciple, verily I say unto you, His reward shall not perish".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 2:47
verses.text: That alms are to be denied to none, also in the same place: "Give to every one that asketh thee; and from him who would wish to borrow, be not turned away".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 2:48
verses.text: Also in the same place: "If thou wilt enter into life, keep the commandments.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 2:49
verses.text: He saith, Which? Jesus saith unto him, Thou shalt not kill, Thou shalt not commit adultery, Thou shalt not bear false witness, Honour thy father and mother: and, Thou shalt love thy neighbour as thyself.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 2:50
verses.text: The young man saith unto Him, All these things have I observed: what lack I yet? Jesus saith unto him, If thou wilt be perfect, go and sell all that thou hast, and give to the poor, and thou shalt have treasure in heaven; and come, follow me".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 2:51
verses.text: Also in the same place: "When the Son of man shall come in His majesty, and all the angels with Him, then He shall sit on the throne of His glory: and all nations shall be gathered together before Him; and He shall separate them one from another, even as a shepherd separates the sheep from the goats: and He shall place the sheep on the right hand, but the goats on the left hand.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 2:52
verses.text: Then shall the King say unto them that are on His right hand, Come, ye blessed of my Father, receive the kingdom prepared for you from the beginning of the world.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 2:53
verses.text: For I was hungry, and ye gave me to eat: I was thirsty, and ye gave me to drink: I was a stranger, and ye took me in: naked, and ye clothed me: I was sick, and ye visited me: I was in prison, and ye came unto me.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 2:54
verses.text: Then shall the righteous answer Him, and say, Lord, when saw we Thee a stranger, and took Thee in: naked, and clothed Thee? And when saw we Thee sick, and in prison, and came to Thee? And the King, answering, shall say unto them, Verily I say unto you, Inasmuch as ye did it to one of the least of these my brethren, ye did it unto me.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 2:55
verses.text: Then shall He say unto them who are on His left hand, Depart from me, ye cursed, into everlasting fire, which my Father hath prepared for the devil and his angels: for I was hungry, and ye gave me not to eat: I was thirsty, and ye gave me not to drink: I was a stranger, and ye took me not in: I was naked, and ye clothed me not: sick, and in prison, and ye visited me not.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 2:56
verses.text: Then shall they also answer, and say, Lord, when saw we Thee hungry, or thirsty, or a stranger, or naked, or sick, or in prison, and did not minister unto Thee? And He shall answer them, Verily I say unto you, Inasmuch as ye did it not to one of the least of these, ye did it not unto me.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 2:57
verses.text: And these shall go away into everlasting burning: but the righteous into life eternal".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 2:58
verses.text: Concerning this same matter in the Gospel according to Luke: "Sell your possessions, and give alms".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 2:59
verses.text: Also in the same place: "He who made that which is within, made that which is without also.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 2:60
verses.text: But give alms, and, behold, all things are pure unto you".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 2:61
verses.text: Also in the same place: "Behold, the half of my substance I give to the poor; and if I have defrauded any one of anything, I restore him fourfold.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 2:62
verses.text: And Jesus said unto him, that salvation has this day been wrought for this house, since he also is a son of Abraham".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 2:63
verses.text: Of this same thing also in the second Epistle to the Corinthians: "Let your abundance supply their want, that their abundance also may be the supplement of your want, that there may be equality: as it is written, He who had much had not excess; and he who had little had no lack".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 2:64
verses.text: Also in the same place: "He who soweth sparingly shall reap also sparingly; and he who soweth in blessing shall reap also of blessing.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 2:65
verses.text: But let every one do as he has proposed in his heart: not as if sorrowfully, or of necessity: for God loveth a cheerful giver".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 2:66
verses.text: Also in the same place: "As it is written, He hath dispersed abroad; he hath given to the poor: his righteousness remaineth for ever".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 2:67
verses.text: Likewise in the same place: "Now he who ministereth seed to the sower, shall both supply bread to be eaten, and shall multiply your seed, and shall increase the growth of the fruits of your righteousness: that in all things ye may be made rich".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 2:68
verses.text: Also in the same place: "The administration of this service has not only supplied that which is lacking to the saints, but has abounded by much giving of thanks unto God".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 2:69
verses.text: Of this same matter in the Epistle of John: "Whoso hath this world's substance, and seeth his brother desiring, and shutteth up his bowels from him, how dwelleth the love of God in him?" Of this same thing in the Gospel according to Luke: "When thou makest a dinner or a supper, call not thy friends, nor brethren, nor neighbours, nor the rich; lest haply they also invite thee again, and a recompense be made thee.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 2:70
verses.text: But when thou makest a banquet, call the poor, the weak, the blind, and lame: and thou shalt be blessed; because they have not the means of rewarding thee: but thou shalt be recompensed in the resurrection of the just".

chapters.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 3

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 3:1
verses.text: In works and alms, even if by smallness of power less be done, that the will itself is sufficient.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 3:2
verses.text: In the second Epistle of Paul to the Corinthians: "If there be a ready will, it is acceptable according to what a man hath, not according to that which he hath not; nor let there be to others a mitigation, but to you a burdening.

chapters.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 4

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 4:1
verses.text: That charity and brotherly affection are to be religiously and stedfastly practised.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 4:2
verses.text: In Malachi: "Hath not one God created us? Is there not one Father of us all? Why have ye certainly deserted every one his brother?" Of this same thing according to John: "Peace I leave with you, my peace I give unto you".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 4:3
verses.text: Also in the same place: "This is my commandment, That ye love one another, even as I have loved you.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 4:4
verses.text: Greater love than this has no man, than that one should lay down his life for his friends".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 4:5
verses.text: Also in the same place: "Blessed are the peacemakers, for they shall be called the sons of God".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 4:6
verses.text: Also in the same place: "Verily I say unto you, That if two of you shall agree on earth concerning everything, whatever you shall ask it shall be given you from my Father which is in heaven.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 4:7
verses.text: For wherever two or three are gathered together in my name, I am with them".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 4:8
verses.text: Of this same thing in the first Epistle to the Corinthians: "And I indeed, brethren, could not speak unto you as to spiritual, but as to carnal, as to babes in Christ.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 4:9
verses.text: I have given you milk for drink, not meat: for while ye were yet little ye were not able to bear it, neither now are ye able.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 4:10
verses.text: For ye are still carnal: for where there are in you emulation, and strife, and dissensions, are ye not carnal, and walk after man?" Likewise in the same place: "And if I should have all faith, so that I can remove mountains, but have not charity, I am nothing.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 4:11
verses.text: And if I should distribute all my goods for food, and if I should deliver up my body to be burned, but have not charity, I avail nothing.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 4:12
verses.text: Charity is great-souled; charity is kind; charity envieth not; charity dealeth not falsely; is not puffed up; is not irritated; thinketh not evil; rejoiceth not in injustice, but rejoiceth in the truth.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 4:13
verses.text: It loveth all things, believeth all things, hopeth all things, beareth all things.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 4:14
verses.text: Charity shall never fail".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 4:15
verses.text: Of this same thing to the Galatians: "Thou shalt love thy neighbour as thyself.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 4:16
verses.text: But if ye bite and accuse one another, see that ye be not consumed one of another".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 4:17
verses.text: Of this same thing in the Epistle of John: "In this appear the children of God and the children of the devil.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 4:18
verses.text: Whosoever is not righteous is not of God, and he who loveth not his brother.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 4:19
verses.text: For he who hateth his brother is a murderer; and ye know that no murderer hath eternal life abiding in him".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 4:20
verses.text: Also in the same place: "If any one shall say that he loves God, and hates his brother, he is a liar: for he who loveth not his brother whom he seeth, how can he love God whom he seeth not?" Of this same thing in the Acts of the Apostles: "But the multitude of them that had believed acted with one soul and mind: nor was there among them any distinction, neither did they esteem as their own anything of the possessions that they had; but all things were common to them".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 4:21
verses.text: Of this same thing in the Gospel according to Matthew: If thou wouldest offer thy gift at the altar, and there rememberest that thy brother hath ought against thee; leave thou thy gift before the altar, and go; first be reconciled to thy brother, and then come and offer thy gift at the altar".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 4:22
verses.text: Also in the Epistle of John: "God is love and he that dwelleth in love dwelleth in God, and God in him".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 4:23
verses.text: Also in the same place: "He who saith he is in the light, and hateth his brother, is a liar, and walketh in darkness even until now".

chapters.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 5

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 5:1
verses.text: That we must boast in nothing, since nothing is our own.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 5:2
verses.text: In the Gospel according to John: "No one can receive anything, except it were given him from heaven".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 5:3
verses.text: Also in the first Epistle of Paul to the Corinthians: "For what hast thou that thou hast not received? But if thou hast received it, why boastest thou, as if thou hadst not received it?" Also in the first of Kings: "Boast not, neither speak lofty things, and let not great speeches proceed out of your mouth, for the Lord is a God of knowledge".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 5:4
verses.text: Also in the same place: "The bow of the mighty men has been made weak, and the weak are girt about with strength".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 5:5
verses.text: Of this same thing in the Maccabees: "It is just to be subjected to God, and that a mortal should not think things equal to God".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 5:6
verses.text: Also in the same place: "And fear not the words of a man that is a sinner, because his glory shall be filth and worms.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 5:7
verses.text: Today he shall be lifted up, and to-morrow he shall not be found; because he is turned into his earth, and his thought has perished".

chapters.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 6

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 6:1
verses.text: That humility and quietness are to be maintained in all things.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 6:2
verses.text: In Isaiah: "Thus saith the Lord God, The heaven is my throne, and the earth is the stool of my feet.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 6:3
verses.text: What seat will ye build for me, or what is the place for my rest? For all those things hath my hand made, and all those things are mine.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 6:4
verses.text: And upon whom else will I look, except upon the lowly and quiet man, and him that trembleth at my words?" On this same thing in the Gospel according to Matthew: "Blessed are the meek, for they shall inherit the earth".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 6:5
verses.text: Of this same thing, too, according to Luke: "He that shall be least among you all, the same shall be great".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 6:6
verses.text: Also in the same place: "Whosoever exalteth himself shall be made low, and whosoever abaseth himself shall be exalted".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 6:7
verses.text: Of this same thing to the Romans: "Be not high-minded, but fear; for if God spared not the natural branches, (take heed) lest He also spare not thee".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 6:8
verses.text: Of this same thing in the thirty-third Psalm: "And He shall save the lowly in spirit".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 6:9
verses.text: Also to the Romans: "Render to all what is due: tribute to whom tribute is due, custom to whom custom, fear to whom fear, honour to whom honour; owe no man anything, except to love another".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 6:10
verses.text: Also in the Gospel according to Matthew: "They love the first place of reclining at feasts, and the chief seat in the synagogues, and salutations in the market, and to be called of men Rabbi.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 6:11
verses.text: But call not ye Rabbi, for One is your Master".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 6:12
verses.text: Also in the Gospel according to John: "The servant is not greater than his lord, nor the apostle greater than He that sent himself.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 6:13
verses.text: If ye know these things, blessed shall ye be if ye shall do them".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 6:14
verses.text: Also in the eighty-first Psalm: "Do justice to the poor and lowly".

chapters.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 7

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 7:1
verses.text: That all good and righteous men suffer more, but ought to endure because they are proved.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 7:2
verses.text: In Solomon: "The furnace proveth the vessels of the potter, and the trial of tribulation righteous men".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 7:3
verses.text: Also in the fiftieth Psalm: "The sacrifice to God is a contrite spirit; a contrite and humbled heart God will not despise".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 7:4
verses.text: Also in the thirty-third Psalm: "God is nearest to them that are contrite in heart, and He will save the lowly in spirit".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 7:5
verses.text: Also in the same place: "Many are the afflictions of the righteous, but out of them all the Lord will deliver them".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 7:6
verses.text: Of this same matter in Job: "Naked came I out of my mother's womb, naked also shall I go under the earth: the Lord gave, and the Lord hath taken away: as it hath pleased the Lord, so it is done; blessed be the name of the Lord.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 7:7
verses.text: In all these things which happened to him Job sinned in nothing with his lips in the sight of the Lord".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 7:8
verses.text: Concerning this same thing in the Gospel according to Matthew: "Blessed are they that mourn, for they shall be comforted".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 7:9
verses.text: Also according to John: "These things have I spoken unto you, that in me ye may have peace.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 7:10
verses.text: But in the world ye shall have affliction; but have confidence, for I have overcome the world".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 7:11
verses.text: Concerning this same thing in the second Epistle to the Corinthians: "There was given to me a thorn in the flesh, a messenger of Satan to buffet me, that I should not be exalted.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 7:12
verses.text: For which thing I thrice besought the Lord, that it should depart from me.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 7:13
verses.text: And He said unto me, My grace is sufficient for thee; for strength is perfected in weakness".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 7:14
verses.text: Concerning this same thing to the Romans: "We glory in hope of the glory of God.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 7:15
verses.text: And not only so, but we also glory in afflictions: knowing that affliction worketh patience; and patience, experience; and experience, hope: and hope does not confound; because the love of God is infused in our hearts by the Holy Spirit, which is given unto us".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 7:16
verses.text: On this same subject, according to Matthew: "How broad and spacious is the way which leadeth unto death, and many there are who go in thereby: how straight and narrow is the way that leadeth to life, and few there are that find it!" Of this same thing in Tobias: "Where are thy righteousnesses? behold what thou sufferest".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 7:17
verses.text: Also in the Wisdom of Solomon: "In the places of the wicked the righteous groan; but at their ruin the righteous will abound".

chapters.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 8

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 8:1
verses.text: That we must not grieve the Holy Spirit, whom we have received.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 8:2
verses.text: Paul the apostle to the Ephesians: "Grieve not the Holy Spirit of God, in which ye were sealed in the day of redemption.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 8:3
verses.text: Let all bitterness, and wrath, and indignation, and clamour, and blasphemy, be taken away from you".

chapters.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 9

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 9:1
verses.text: That anger must be overcome, lest it constrain us to sin.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 9:2
verses.text: In Solomon in the Proverbs: "Better is a patient man than a strong man; for he who restrains his anger is better than he who taketh a city".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 9:3
verses.text: Also in the same place: "The imprudent man declareth his anger on the same day, but the crafty man hideth away his dishonour".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 9:4
verses.text: Of this same thing to the Ephesians: "Be ye angry, and sin not.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 9:5
verses.text: Let not the sun set upon your wrath".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 9:6
verses.text: Also in the Gospel according to Matthew: "Ye have heard that it was said by the ancients, Thou shalt not kill; and whoever shall kill shall be guilty of the judgment.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 9:7
verses.text: But I say unto you, That every one who is angry with his brother without cause shall be guilty of the judgment".

chapters.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 10

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 10:1
verses.text: That brethren ought to support one another.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 10:2
verses.text: To the Galatians: "Each one having others in consideration, lest ye also should be tempted.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 10:3
verses.text: Bear ye one another's burdens, and so ye shall fulfil the law of Christ".

chapters.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 11

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 11:1
verses.text: That we must trust in God only, and in Him we must glory.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 11:2
verses.text: In Jeremiah: "Let not the wise man glory in his wisdom, neither let the strong man glory in his strength, nor let the rich man glory in his riches; but let him that glorieth glory in this, that he understands and knows that I am the Lord, who do mercy, and judgment, and righteousness upon the earth, because in them is my pleasure, saith the Lord".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 11:3
verses.text: Of the same thing in the fifty-fourth Psalm: "In the Lord have I hoped; I will not fear what man can do unto me".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 11:4
verses.text: Also in the same place: "To none but God alone is my soul subjected".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 11:5
verses.text: Also in the cxviith Psalm: "I will not fear what man can do unto me; the Lord is my helper".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 11:6
verses.text: Also in the same place: "It is good to trust in the Lord rather than to trust in man; it is good to hope in the Lord rather than to hope in princes".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 11:7
verses.text: Of this same thing in Daniel: "But Shadrach, Meshach, and Abednego answered and said to king Nebuchadnezzar, O king, there is no need to answer thee concerning this word.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 11:8
verses.text: For God, whom we serve, is able to deliver us from the furnace of burning fire; and He will deliver us from thine hand, O king.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 11:9
verses.text: And if not, be it known unto thee that we serve not thy gods, and we adore not the golden image which thou hast set up".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 11:10
verses.text: Likewise in Jeremiah: "Cursed is the man who hath hope in man; and blessed is the man who trusts in the Lord, and his hope shall be in God".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 11:11
verses.text: Concerning this same thing in Deuteronomy: "Thou shalt worship the Lord thy God, and Him only shalt thou serve".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 11:12
verses.text: Of this same thing to the Romans: "And they worshipped and served the creature, forsaking the Creator.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 11:13
verses.text: Wherefore also God gave them up to ignominious passions".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 11:14
verses.text: Of this thing also in John: "Greater is He who is in you than he who is in this world".

chapters.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 12

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 12:1
verses.text: That he who has attained to trust, having put off the former man, ought to regard only celestial and spiritual things, and to give no heed to the world which he has already renounced.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 12:2
verses.text: In Isaiah: "Seek ye the Lord; and when ye have found Him, call upon Him.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 12:3
verses.text: But when He hath come near unto you, let the wicked forsake his ways, and the unrighteous man his thoughts: and let him be turned unto the Lord, and he shall obtain mercy, because He will plentifully pardon your sins".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 12:4
verses.text: Of this same thing in Solomon: "I have seen all the works which are done under the sun; and, lo, all are vanity".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 12:5
verses.text: Of this same thing in Exodus: "But thus shall ye eat it; your loins girt, and your shoes on your feet, and your staves in your hands: and ye shall eat it in haste, for it is the Lord's passover".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 12:6
verses.text: Of this same thing in the Gospel according to Matthew: "Take no thought, saying, What shall we eat? or, What shall we drink? or, Wherewith shall we be clothed? for these things the nations seek after.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 12:7
verses.text: But your Father knoweth that ye have need of all these things.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 12:8
verses.text: Seek first the kingdom of God, and His righteousness; and all these things shall be added unto you".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 12:9
verses.text: Likewise in the same place: "Think not for the morrow, for the morrow shall take thought for itself.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 12:10
verses.text: Sufficient unto the day is its own evil".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 12:11
verses.text: Likewise in the same place: "No one looking back, and putting his hands to the plough, is fit for the kingdom of God".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 12:12
verses.text: Also in the same place: "Behold the fowls of the heaven: for they sow not, nor reap, nor gather into barns; and your heavenly Father feedeth them.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 12:13
verses.text: Are not ye of more value than they?" Concerning this same thing, according to Luke: "Let your loins be girded, and your lamps burning; and ye like unto men that wait for their lord, when he cometh from the wedding; that, when he cometh and knocketh, they may open to him.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 12:14
verses.text: Blessed are those servants, whom their lord, when he cometh, shall find watching".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 12:15
verses.text: Of this same thing in Matthew: "The foxes have holes, and the birds of the heaven have nests; but the Son of man hath not where He may lay His head".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 12:16
verses.text: Also in the same place: "Whoso forsaketh not all that he hath, cannot be my disciple".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 12:17
verses.text: Of this same thing in the first to the Corinthians: "Ye are not your own, for ye are bought with a great price.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 12:18
verses.text: Glorify and bear God in your body".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 12:19
verses.text: Also in the same place: "The time is limited.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 12:20
verses.text: It remaineth, therefore, that both they who have wives be as though they have them not, and they who lament as they that lament not, and they that rejoice as they that rejoice not, and they who buy as they that buy not, and they who possess as they who possess not, and they who use this world as they that use it not; for the fashion of this world passeth away".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 12:21
verses.text: Also in the same place: "The first man is of the clay of the earth, the second man from heaven.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 12:22
verses.text: As he is of the clay, such also are they who are of the clay; and as is the heavenly, such also are the heavenly.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 12:23
verses.text: Even as we have borne the image of him who is of the clay, let us bear His image also who is from heaven".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 12:24
verses.text: Of this same matter to the Philippians: "All seek their own, and not those things which are Christ's; whose end is destruction, whose god is their belly, and their glory is to their confusion, who mind earthly things.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 12:25
verses.text: For our conversation is in heaven, whence also we expect the Saviour, our Lord Jesus Christ, who shall transform the body of our humiliation conformed to the body of His glory".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 12:26
verses.text: Of this very matter to Galatians: "But be it far from me to boast, except in the cross of our Lord Jesus Christ, by whom the world is crucified unto me, and I unto the world".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 12:27
verses.text: Concerning this same thing to Timothy: "No man that warreth for God bindeth himself with worldly annoyances, that he may please Him to whom he hath approved himself.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 12:28
verses.text: But and if a man should contend, he will not be crowned unless he fight lawfully".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 12:29
verses.text: Of this same thing to the Colossians: "If ye be dead with Christ from the elements of the world, why still, as if living in the world, do ye follow vain things?" Also concerning this same thing: "If ye have risen together with Christ, seek those things which are above, where Christ is sitting on the right hand of God.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 12:30
verses.text: Give heed to the things that are above, not to those things which are on the earth; for ye are dead, and your life is hidden with Christ in God.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 12:31
verses.text: But when Christ your life shall appear, then shall ye also appear with Him in glory".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 12:32
verses.text: Of this same thing to the Ephesians: Put off the old man of the former conversation, who is corrupted, according to the lusts of deceit.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 12:33
verses.text: But be ye renewed in the spirit of your mind, and put on the new man, him who according to God is ordained in righteousness, and holiness, and truth".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 12:34
verses.text: Of this same thing in the Epistle of Peter: "As strangers and pilgrims, abstain from fleshly lusts, which war against the soul; but having a good conversation among the Gentiles, that while they detract from you as if from evildoers, yet, beholding your good works, they may magnify God".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 12:35
verses.text: Of this same thing in the Epistle of John: "He who saith he abideth in Christ, ought himself also to walk even as He walked".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 12:36
verses.text: Also in the same place: "Love not the world, neither the things that are in the world.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 12:37
verses.text: If any man loveth the world, the love of the Father is not in him.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 12:38
verses.text: Because everything which is in the world is lust of the flesh, and lust of the eyes, and the ambition of this world, which is not of the Father, but of the lust of this world.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 12:39
verses.text: And the world shall pass away with its lust.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 12:40
verses.text: But he that doeth the will of God abideth for ever, even as God abideth for ever".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 12:41
verses.text: Also in the first Epistle of Paul to the Corinthians: "Purge out the old leaven, that ye may be a new dough, as ye are unleavened.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 12:42
verses.text: For also Christ our passover is sacrificed.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 12:43
verses.text: Therefore let us celebrate the feast, not in the old leaven, nor in the leaven of malice and wickedness, but in the unleavened bread of sincerity and truth".

chapters.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 13

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 13:1
verses.text: That we must not swear.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 13:2
verses.text: In Solomon: "A man that sweareth much shall be filled with iniquity, and the plague shall not depart from his house; and if he swear vainly, he shall not be justified".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 13:3
verses.text: Of this same matter, according to Matthew: "(Again, ye have heard that it was said to them of old, Thou shalt not swear falsely, but shalt perform unto the Lord thine oaths.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 13:4
verses.text: ) I say unto you, Swear not at all: (neither by heaven, because it is God's throne; nor by the earth, because it is His footstool; nor by Jerusalem, because it is the city of the great King; neither shalt thou swear by thy head, because thou canst not make one hair white or black.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 13:5
verses.text: ) But let your discourse be, Yea, yea; Nay, nay: (for whatever is fuller than these is of evil".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 13:6
verses.text: ) Of this same thing in Exodus: "Thou shalt not take the name of the Lord thy God in vain".

chapters.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 14

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 14:1
verses.text: That we must not curse.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 14:2
verses.text: In Exodus: "Thou shalt not curse nor speak ill of the ruler of thy people".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 14:3
verses.text: Also in the thirty-third Psalm: "Who is the man who desires life, and loveth to see good days? Restrain thy tongue from evil, and thy lips that they speak no guile".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 14:4
verses.text: Of this same thing in Leviticus: "And the Lord spoke to Moses, saying, Bring forth him who hath cursed abroad outside the camp; and all who heard him shall place their hands upon his head, and all the assembly of the children of Israel shall stone him".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 14:5
verses.text: Of this same thing in Paul's Epistle to the Ephesians: "Let no evil discourse proceed out of your mouth, but that which is good for the edification of faith, that it may give grace to the hearers".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 14:6
verses.text: Of this same thing to the Romans: "Blessing, and not cursing".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 14:7
verses.text: Of this same thing in the Gospel according to Matthew: "He who shall say to his brother, Thou fool! shall be liable to the Gehenna of fire".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 14:8
verses.text: Of this same matter, according to the same Matthew: "But I say unto you, That every idle word which men shall speak, they shall give account for it in the day of judgment.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 14:9
verses.text: For by thy words thou shalt be justified, and by thy words thou shalt be condemned".

chapters.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 15

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 15:1
verses.text: That we must never murmur, but bless God concerning all things that happen.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 15:2
verses.text: In Job: "Say some word against the Lord, and die.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 15:3
verses.text: But he, looking upon her, said, Thou speakest as one of the foolish women.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 15:4
verses.text: If we have received good things from the Lord's hand, why shall we not endure evil things? In all these things which happened unto him, Job sinned not with his lips in the sight of the Lord".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 15:5
verses.text: Also in the same place: "Hast thou regarded my servant Job? for there is none like unto him in the earth: a man without complaint: a true worshipper of God, restraining himself from all evil".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 15:6
verses.text: Of the same thing in the thirty-third Psalm: "I will bless the Lord at all times: His praise shall ever be in my mouth".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 15:7
verses.text: Of this same thing in Numbers: "Let their murmuring cease from me, and they shall not die".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 15:8
verses.text: Of this same thing in the Acts of the Apostles: "But about the middle of the night Paul and Silas prayed and gave thanks to God, and the prisoners heard them".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 15:9
verses.text: Also in the Epistle of Paul to the Philippians: "But doing all things for love, without murmurings and revilings, that ye may be without complaint, and spotless sons of God".

chapters.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 16

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 16:1
verses.text: That men are tried by God for this purpose, that they may be proved.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 16:2
verses.text: In Genesis: "And God, tempted Abraham, and said to him, Take thy only son whom thou lovest, Isaac, and go into the high land, and offer him there as a burnt-offering on one of the mountains of which I will tell thee".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 16:3
verses.text: Of this same thing in Deuteronomy: "The Lord your God proveth you, that He may know if ye love the Lord your God with all your heart, and with all your soul".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 16:4
verses.text: Of this same thing in the Wisdom of Solomon: "Although in the sight of men they suffered torments, their hope is full of immortality; and having been in few things distressed, yet in many things they shall be happily ordered, because God tried them, and found them worthy of Himself.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 16:5
verses.text: As gold in the furnace He proved them, and as a burnt-offering He received them.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 16:6
verses.text: And in their time there shall be respect of them; they shall judge the nations, and shall rule over the people; and their Lord shall reign for ever".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 16:7
verses.text: Of this same thing in the Maccabees: "Was not Abraham found faithful in temptation, and it was accounted unto him for righteousness?".

chapters.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 17

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 17:1
verses.text: Of the benefits of martyrdom.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 17:2
verses.text: In the Proverbs of Solomon: "The faithful martyr delivers his soul from evils".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 17:3
verses.text: Also in the same place: "Then shall the righteous stand in great boldness against them who have afflicted them, and who took away their labours.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 17:4
verses.text: When they see them, they shall be disturbed with a horrible fear; and they shall wonder at the suddenness of their unhoped-for salvation, saying among themselves, repenting and groaning with distress of spirit, These are they whom some time we had in derision, and in the likeness of a proverb; we fools counted their life madness, and their end without honour.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 17:5
verses.text: How are they reckoned among the children of God, and their lot among the saints! Therefore we have wandered from the way of truth, and the light of righteousness has not shined upon us, and the sun has not risen upon us.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 17:6
verses.text: We have been wearied in the way of iniquity and of perdition, and we have walked through difficult solitudes; but we have not known the way of the Lord.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 17:7
verses.text: What hath pride profited us? or what hath the boasting of riches brought to us? All these things have passed away as a shadow".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 17:8
verses.text: Of this same thing in the cxvth Psalm: "Precious in the sight of the Lord is the death of His saints".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 17:9
verses.text: Also in the cxxvth Psalm: "They who sow in tears shall reap in joy.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 17:10
verses.text: Walking they walked, and wept as they cast their seeds; but coming they shall come in joy, raising up their laps".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 17:11
verses.text: Of this same thing in the Gospel according to John: "He who loveth his life shall lose it; and he that hateth his life in this world shall find it to life eternal".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 17:12
verses.text: Also in the same place: "But when they shall deliver you up, take no thought what ye shall speak; for it is not ye who speak, but the Spirit of your Father which speaketh in you".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 17:13
verses.text: Also in the same place: "The hour shall come, that every one that killeth you shall think he doeth service to God; but they shall do this also because they have not known the Father nor me".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 17:14
verses.text: Of this same matter, according to Matthew: "Blessed are they which shall suffer persecution for righteousness' sake; for theirs is the kingdom of heaven".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 17:15
verses.text: Also in the same place: "Fear not them which kill the body, but are not able to kill the soul; but rather fear Him which is able to kill the soul and body in Gehenna".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 17:16
verses.text: Also in the same place: "Whosoever shall confess me before men, him also will I confess before my Father which is in heaven; but he who shall deny me before men, him also will I deny before my Father which is in heaven.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 17:17
verses.text: And he that shall endure to the end, the same shall be saved".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 17:18
verses.text: Of this same thing, according to Luke: "Blessed shall ye be when men shall hate you, and shall separate you (from their company), and shall drive you out, and shall speak evil of your name, as wicked, for the Son of man's sake.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 17:19
verses.text: Rejoice in that day, and exult; for, lo, your reward is great in heaven".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 17:20
verses.text: Also in the same place: "Verily I say unto you, There is no man that leaveth house, or parents, or brethren, or wife, or children, for the sake of the kingdom of God, and does not receive seven times as much in this present time, but in the world to come life everlasting".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 17:21
verses.text: Of this same thing in the Apocalypse: "And when he had opened the fifth seal, I saw under the altar of God the souls of them that were slain on account of the word of God and His testimony.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 17:22
verses.text: And they cried with a loud voice, saying, How long, O Lord, holy and true, dost Thou not judge and avenge our blood on them that dwell on the earth? And unto every one of them were given white robes; and it was said to them, that they should rest still for a short time, until the number of their fellow-servants, and of their brethren, should be fulfilled, and they who shall afterwards be slain, after their example".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 17:23
verses.text: Also in the same place: "After these things I saw a great crowd, which no one among them could number, from every nation, and from every tribe, and from every people and tongue, standing before the throne and before the Lamb; and they were clothed with white robes, and palms were in their hands.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 17:24
verses.text: And they said with a loud voice, Salvation to our God, that sitteth upon the throne, and to the Lamb.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 17:25
verses.text: And one of the elders answered and said to me, What are these which are clothed with white robes? who are they, and whence have they come? And I said unto him, My lord, thou knowest.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 17:26
verses.text: And he said unto me, These are they who have come out of great tribulation, and have washed their robes, and made them white in the blood of the Lamb.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 17:27
verses.text: Therefore they are before the throne of God, and serve Him day and night in His temple; and He who sitteth upon the throne shall dwell among them.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 17:28
verses.text: They shall neither hunger nor thirst ever; and neither shall the sun fall upon them, nor shall they suffer any heat: for the Lamb who is in the midst of the throne shall protect them, and shall lead them to the fountains of the waters of life; and God shall wipe away every tear from their eyes".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 17:29
verses.text: Also in the same place: "He who shall overcome I will give him to eat of the tree of life, which is in the paradise of my God".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 17:30
verses.text: Also in the same place: "Be thou faithful even unto death, and I will give thee a crown of life".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 17:31
verses.text: Also in the same place: "Blessed shall they be who shall watch, and shall keep their garments, lest they walk naked, and they see their shame".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 17:32
verses.text: Of this same thing, Paul in the second Epistle to Timothy: "I am now offered up, and the time of my assumption is at hand.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 17:33
verses.text: I have fought a good fight, I have finished my course, I have kept the faith.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 17:34
verses.text: There now remains for me a crown of righteousness, which the Lord, the righteous Judge, will give me in that day; and not only to me, but to all also who love His appearing".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 17:35
verses.text: Of this same thing to the Romans: "We are the sons of God: but if sons and heirs of God, we are also joint-heirs with Christ; if we suffer together, that we may also be magnified together".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 17:36
verses.text: Of this same thing in the cxviiith Psalm: "Blessed are they who are undefiled in the way, and walk in the law of the Lord.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 17:37
verses.text: Blessed are they who search into His testimonies".

chapters.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 18

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 18:1
verses.text: That what we suffer in this world is of less account than is the reward which is promised.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 18:2
verses.text: In the Epistle of Paul to the Romans: "The sufferings of this present time are not worthy of comparison with the glory that is to come after, which shall be revealed in us".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 18:3
verses.text: Of this same thing in the Maccabees: "O Lord, who hast the holy knowledge, it is manifest that while I might be delivered from death, I am suffering most cruel pains of body, being beaten with whips; yet in spirit I suffer these things willingly, because of the fear of thine own self".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 18:4
verses.text: Also in the same place: "Thou indeed, being powerless, destroyest us out of this present life; but the King of the world shall raise us up who have died for His laws into the eternal resurrection of life".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 18:5
verses.text: Also in the same place: "It is better that, given up to death by men, we should expect hope from God to be raised again by Him.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 18:6
verses.text: For there shall be no resurrection to life for thee".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 18:7
verses.text: Also in the same place: "Having power among men, although thou art corruptible, thou doest what thou wilt.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 18:8
verses.text: But think not that our race is forsaken of God.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 18:9
verses.text: Sustain, and see how His great power will torment thee and thy seed".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 18:10
verses.text: Also in the same place: Do not err without cause; for we suffer these things on our own accounts, as sinners against our God.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 18:11
verses.text: But think not thou that thou shalt be unpunished, having undertaken to fight against God".

chapters.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 19

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 19:1
verses.text: That nothing is to be preferred to the love of God and Christ.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 19:2
verses.text: In Deuteronomy: "Thou shalt love the Lord thy God with all thy heart, and with all thy soul, and with all thy might".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 19:3
verses.text: Also in the Gospel according to Matthew: "He that loveth father or mother above me, is not worthy of me; and he that loveth son or daughter above me, is not worthy of me; and he that taketh not up his cross and followeth me, is not my disciple".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 19:4
verses.text: Also in the Epistle of Paul to the Romans: "Who shall separate us from the love of Christ? shall tribulation, or distress, or persecution, or famine, or nakedness, or peril, or sword? As it is written, Because for thy sake we are killed all the day long, we are counted as sheep for the slaughter.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 19:5
verses.text: But in all these things we are more than conquerors for His sake who loved us".

chapters.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 20

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 20:1
verses.text: That we are not to obey our own will, but the will of God.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 20:2
verses.text: In the Gospel according to John: "I came not down from heaven to do mine own will, but the will of Him that sent me".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 20:3
verses.text: Of this same matter, according to Matthew: "Father, if it be possible, let this cup pass from me; nevertheless, not what I will, but what Thou wilt".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 20:4
verses.text: Also in the daily prayer: "Thy will be done, as in heaven, so in earth".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 20:5
verses.text: Also according to Matthew: "Not every one who saith unto me, Lord, Lord, shall enter into the kingdom of heaven; but he who doeth the will of my Father which is in heaven, he shall enter into the kingdom of heaven".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 20:6
verses.text: Also according to Luke: "But that servant which knoweth his Lord's will, and obeyed not His will, shall be beaten with many stripes".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 20:7
verses.text: In the Epistle of John: "But he that doeth the will of God abideth for ever, even as He Himself also abideth for ever".

chapters.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 21

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 21:1
verses.text: That the foundation and strength of hope and faith is fear.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 21:2
verses.text: In the cxth Psalm: "The fear of the Lord is the beginning of wisdom".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 21:3
verses.text: Of the same thing in the Wisdom of Solomon: "The beginning of wisdom is to fear God".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 21:4
verses.text: Also in the Proverbs of the same: "Blessed is the man who reverences all things with fear".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 21:5
verses.text: Of the same thing in Isaiah: "And upon whom else will I look, except upon him that is lowly and peaceful, and that trembleth at my words?" Of this same thing in Genesis: "And the angel of the Lord called him from heaven, and said unto him, Abraham, Abraham: and he said, Here am I.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 21:6
verses.text: And he said, Lay not thine hand upon the lad, neither do anything unto him: for now I know that thou fearest thy God, and hast not spared thy beloved son for my sake".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 21:7
verses.text: Also in the second Psalm: "Serve the Lord in fear, and rejoice unto Him in trembling".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 21:8
verses.text: Also in Deuteronomy, the word of God to Moses: "Call the people together to me, and let them hear my words, that they may learn to fear me all the days that they themselves shall live upon the earth".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 21:9
verses.text: Also in Jeremiah: "Behold, the days come, saith the Lord, that I will perfect upon the house of Israel, and in the house of Judah, a new covenant: not according to the covenant that I had ordered with their fathers in the day when I laid hold of their hand to bring them out of the land of Egypt; because they have not abode in my covenant, and I have been unmindful of them, saith the Lord; because this is the covenant which I will ordain for the house of Israel; After those days, saith the Lord, I will give my law, and will write it in their mind and I will be to them for a God, and they shall be to me for a people.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 21:10
verses.text: And they shall not teach every man his brother, saying, Know the Lord: because all shall know me, from the least even to the greatest of them: because I will be favourable to their iniquities, and their sins I will not remember any more.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 21:11
verses.text: If the heaven should be lifted up on high, saith the Lord, and if the earth should be made low from beneath, yet I will not cast away the people of Israel, saith the Lord, for all the things which they have done.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 21:12
verses.text: Behold, I will gather them together from every land in which I have scattered them in anger, and in my fury, and in great indignation; and I will grind them down into that place, and I will leave them in fear; and they shall be to me for a people, and I will be to them for a God: and I will give them another way, and another heart, that they may fear me all their days in prosperity with their children: and I will perfect for them an everlasting covenant, which I will not turn away after them; and I will put my fear into their heart, that they may not depart from me: and I will visit upon them to do them good, and to plant them in their land in faith, and with all the heart, and with all the mind".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 21:13
verses.text: Also in the Apocalypse: "And the four and twenty elders which sit on their thrones in the sight (of God), fell upon their faces, and worshipped God, saying, We give Thee thanks, O Lord God omnipotent, which art and which wast; because Thou hast taken Thy great power, and hast reigned.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 21:14
verses.text: And the nations were angry, and Thy wrath is come, and the time in which it should be judged concerning the dead, and the reward should be given to Thy servants the prophets, and the saints that fear Thy name, small and great; and to disperse those who have corrupted the earth".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 21:15
verses.text: Also in the same place: "And I saw another angel flying through the midst of the heaven, having the everlasting Gospel to preach to those who dwell upon the earth, and to all the nations, and tribes, and tongues, and peoples, saying with a loud voice, Fear God, and give Him honour, because the hour of His judgment is come; and adore Him who made the heaven, and the earth, and the sea, and the fountains of waters".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 21:16
verses.text: Also in the same place: "And I saw as it were a sea of glass mingled with fire; and the beasts were feeding with His lambs; and the number of His name a hundred and forty and four, standing upon the sea of glass, having the harps of God; and they sing the song of Moses, the servant of God, and the song of the Lamb, saying, Great and marvellous are Thy works, O Lord God Almighty; just and true are Thy ways, Thou King of the nations.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 21:17
verses.text: Who would not fear Thee, and give honour to Thy name? for Thou only art holy: and because all nations shall come and worship in Thy sight, because Thy righteousnesses have been made manifest".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 21:18
verses.text: Also in Daniel: "There was a man dwelling in Babylon whose name was Joachim; and he took a wife by name Susanna, the daughter of Helchias, a very beautiful woman, and one that feared the Lord.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 21:19
verses.text: And her parents were righteous, and taught their daughter according to the law of Moses".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 21:20
verses.text: Moreover, in Daniel: "And we are lowly this day in all the earth because of our sins, and there is not at this time any prince, or prophet, or leader, or burnt-offering, or oblation, or sacrifice, or incense, or place to sacrifice before Thee, and to find mercy from Thee.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 21:21
verses.text: And yet in the soul and spirit of lowliness let us be accepted as the burnt-offerings of rams and bulls, and as it were many thousands of lambs which are fattest.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 21:22
verses.text: If our offering may be made in Thy presence this day, their power shall be consumed, for they shall not be ashamed who put their trust in Thee.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 21:23
verses.text: And now we follow with our whole heart, and we fear and seek Thy face.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 21:24
verses.text: Give us not over unto reproach, but do with us according to Thy tranquillity, and according to the multitude of Thy mercy deliver us".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 21:25
verses.text: Also in the same place: "And the king exceedingly rejoiced, and commanded Daniel to be taken up out of the den of lions; and the lions had done him no hurt, because he trusted and had believed in his God.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 21:26
verses.text: And the king commanded, and they brought those men who had accused Daniel; and they cast them in the den of lions, and their wives and their children.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 21:27
verses.text: And before they had reached the pavement of the den they were seized by the lions, and they brake all their bones in pieces.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 21:28
verses.text: Then Darius the king wrote, To all peoples, tribes, and languages which are in my kingdom, peace be unto you from my face.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 21:29
verses.text: I decree and ordain that all those who are in my kingdom shall fear and tremble before the most high God whom Daniel serves, because He is the God who liveth and abideth for ever, and His kingdom shall not pass away, and His dominion goeth on for ever; and He alone doeth signs, and prodigies, and marvellous things in the heaven and the earth, who snatched Daniel from the den of lions".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 21:30
verses.text: Also in Micah: "Wherewith shall I approach the Lord, and lay hold upon Him? in sacrifices, in burnt-offerings, in calves of a year old? Does the Lord favour and receive me with thousands of fat goats? or shall I give my first-fruits of unrighteousness, the fruit of my belly, the sin of my soul? It is told thee, O man, what is good; or what else the Lord doth require, save that thou shouldst do judgment and justice, and love mercy, and be ready to go with the Lord thy God.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 21:31
verses.text: The voice of the Lord shall be invoked in the city, and He will save those who fear His name".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 21:32
verses.text: Also in Micah: "Feed Thy people with Thy rod, the sheep of Thine inheritance; and pluck up those who dwell separately in the midst of Carmel.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 21:33
verses.text: They shall prepare Bashan and Gilead according to the days of the age; and according to the days of their going forth from the land of Egypt I will show them wonderful things.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 21:34
verses.text: The nations shall see, and be confounded at all their might; and they shall place their hand upon their mouth.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 21:35
verses.text: Their ears shall be deafened, and they shall lick the dust as do serpents.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 21:36
verses.text: Dragging the earth, they shall be disturbed, and they shall lick the dust: in their end they shall be afraid towards the Lord their God, and they shall fear because of Thee.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 21:37
verses.text: Who is a God as Thou art, raising up unrighteousness, and passing over impiety?" And in Nahum: "The mountains were moved at Him, and the hills trembled; and the earth was laid bare before His face, and all who dwell therein.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 21:38
verses.text: From the face of His anger who shall bear it, and who withstandeth in the fury of His soul? His rage causes the beginnings to flow, and the rocks were melted by Him.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 21:39
verses.text: The Lord is good to those who sustain Him in the day of affliction, and knoweth those who fear Him".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 21:40
verses.text: Also in Haggai: "And Zerubbabel the son of Salathiel, of the tribe of Judah, and Jesus the son of Josedech, the high priest, and all who remained of the people, obeyed the voice of the Lord their God, because the Lord sent him to them, and the people feared from the face of God".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 21:41
verses.text: Also in Malachi: "The covenant was with life and peace; and I gave to them the fear to fear me from the face of my name".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 21:42
verses.text: Also in the thirty-third Psalm: "Fear the Lord, all ye His saints: for there is no want to them that fear Him".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 21:43
verses.text: Also in the eighteenth Psalm: "The fear of the Lord is chaste, abiding for ever".

chapters.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 22

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 22:1
verses.text: That we must not rashly judge of another.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 22:2
verses.text: In the Gospel according to Luke: "Judge not, that ye be not judged: condemn not, that ye be not condemned".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 22:3
verses.text: Of this same subject to the Romans: "Who art thou that judgest another man's servant? to his own master he standeth or falleth.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 22:4
verses.text: But he shall stand; for God is able to make him stand".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 22:5
verses.text: And again: "Wherefore thou art without excuse, O every man that judgest: for in that in which thou judgest another, thou condemnest thyself; for thou doest the same things which thou judgest.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 22:6
verses.text: But dost thou hope, who judgest those who do evil, and doest the same, that thou thyself shalt escape the judgment of God?" Also in the first Epistle of Paul to the Corinthians: "And let him that thinketh he standeth take heed lest he fall".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 22:7
verses.text: And again: "If any man thinketh that he knoweth anything, he knoweth not yet in what manner he ought to know".

chapters.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 23

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 23:1
verses.text: That when we have received a wrong, we must remit and forgive it.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 23:2
verses.text: In the Gospel, in the daily prayer: "Forgive us our debts, even as we forgive our debtors".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 23:3
verses.text: Also according to Mark: "And when ye stand for prayer, forgive, if ye have ought against any one; that also your Father who is in heaven may forgive you your sins.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 23:4
verses.text: But if ye do not forgive, neither will your Father which is in heaven forgive you your sins".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 23:5
verses.text: Also in the same place: "In what measure ye mete, in that shall it be measured to you again".

chapters.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 24

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 24:1
verses.text: That evil is not to be returned for evil.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 24:2
verses.text: In the Epistle of Paul to the Romans: "Rendering to no man evil for evil".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 24:3
verses.text: Also in the same place: "Not to be overcome of evil, but overcome evil with good".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 24:4
verses.text: Of this same thing in the Apocalypse: "And He said unto me, Seal not the words of the prophecy of this book; because now the time is at hand.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 24:5
verses.text: And let those who persist in hurting, hurt: and let him who is filthy, be filthy still: but let the righteous do still more righteousness: and in like manner, let him that is holy do still more holiness.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 24:6
verses.text: Behold, I come quickly; and my reward is with me, to render to every man according to his deeds".

chapters.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 25

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 25:1
verses.text: That it is impossible to attain to the Father but by His Son Jesus Christ.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 25:2
verses.text: In the Gospel according to John: "I am the way, the truth, and the life: no man cometh unto the Father, but by me".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 25:3
verses.text: Also in the same place: "I am the door: by me if any man enter in, he shall be saved".

chapters.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 26

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 26:1
verses.text: That unless a man have been baptized and born again, he cannot attain unto the kingdom of God.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 26:2
verses.text: In the Gospel according to John: "Except a man be born again of water and the Spirit, he cannot enter into the kingdom of God.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 26:3
