verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 94:2
verses.text: In the first epistle of Paul to the Corinthians: "Heresies must needs be, in order that they which are approved may be made manifest among you".

chapters.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 95

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 95:1
verses.text: That the Eucharist is to be received with fear and honour.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 95:2
verses.text: In Leviticus: "But whatever soul shall eat of the flesh of the sacrifice of salvation, which is the Lord's, and his uncleanness is still upon him, that soul shall perish from his people".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 95:3
verses.text: Also in the first to the Corinthians: "Whosoever shall eat the bread or drink the cup of the Lord unworthily, shall be guilty of the body and blood of the Lord".

chapters.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 96

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 96:1
verses.text: That we are to live with the good, but to avoid the evil.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 96:2
verses.text: In Solomon, in the Proverbs: "Bring not the impious man into the habitation of the righteous".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 96:3
verses.text: Also in the same, in Ecclesiasticus: "Let righteous men be thy guests".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 96:4
verses.text: And again: "The faithful friend is a medicine of life and of immortality".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 96:5
verses.text: Also in the same place: "Be thou far from the man who has the power to slay, and thou shalt not suspect fear".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 96:6
verses.text: Also in the same place: "Blessed is he who findeth a true friend, and who speaketh righteousness to the listening ear".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 96:7
verses.text: Also in the same place: "Hedge thine ears with thorns, and hear not a wicked tongue".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 96:8
verses.text: Also in the seventeenth Psalm: "With the righteous Thou shalt be justified; and with the innocent man Thou shalt be innocent; and with the froward man Thou shalt be froward".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 96:9
verses.text: Also in the first Epistle of Paul to the Corinthians: "Evil communications corrupt good dispositions".

chapters.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 97

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 97:1
verses.text: That we must labour not with words, but with deeds.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 97:2
verses.text: In Solomon, in Ecclesiasticus: "Be not hasty in thy tongue, and in thy deeds useless and remiss".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 97:3
verses.text: And Paul, in the first to the Corinthians: "The kingdom of God is not in word, but in power".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 97:4
verses.text: Also to the Romans: "Not the hearers of the law are righteous before God, but the doers of the law shall be justified".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 97:5
verses.text: Also in the Gospel according to Matthew: "He who shall do and teach so, shall be called greatest in the kingdom of heaven".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 97:6
verses.text: Also in the same place: "Every one who heareth my words, and doeth them, I will liken him to a wise man who built his house upon a rock.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 97:7
verses.text: The rain descended, the floods came, the winds blew, and beat upon that house, and it fell not: for it was founded upon a rock.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 97:8
verses.text: And every one who heareth my words, and doeth them not, I will liken him to the foolish man, who built his house upon the sand.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 97:9
verses.text: The rain descended, the floods came, the winds blew, and beat upon that house; and it fell: and its ruin became great".

chapters.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 98

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 98:1
verses.text: That we must hasten to faith and to attainment.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 98:2
verses.text: In Solomon, in Ecclesiasticus: "Delay not to be converted to God, and do not put off from day to day; for His anger cometh suddenly".

chapters.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 99

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 99:1
verses.text: That the catechumen ought now no longer to sin.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 99:2
verses.text: In the Epistle of Paul to the Romans: "Let us do evil until the good things come; whose condemnation is just".

chapters.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 100

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 100:1
verses.text: That judgment will be according to the times, either of equity before the law, or of law after Moses.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 100:2
verses.text: Paul to the Romans: "As many as have sinned without law, shall perish without law; and as many as have sinned in the law, shall be judged also by the law".

chapters.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 101

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 101:1
verses.text: That the grace of God ought to be without price.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 101:2
verses.text: In the Acts of the Apostles: "Thy money be in perdition with thyself, because thou hast thought that the grace of God is possessed by money".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 101:3
verses.text: Also in the Gospel: "Freely ye have received, freely give".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 101:4
verses.text: Also in the same place: "Ye have made my Father's house a house of merchandise; and ye have made the house of prayer a den of thieves".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 101:5
verses.text: Also in Isaiah: "Ye who thirst, go to the water, and as many as have not money: go, and buy, and drink without money".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 101:6
verses.text: Also in the Apocalypse: "I am Alpha and Omega, the beginning and the end.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 101:7
verses.text: I will give to him that thirsteth from the fountain of the water of life freely.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 101:8
verses.text: He who shall overcome shall possess these things, and their inheritance; and I will be his God, and he shall be my son".

chapters.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 102

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 102:1
verses.text: That the Holy Spirit has frequently appeared in fire.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 102:2
verses.text: In Exodus: "And the whole of Mount Sinai smoked, because God had come down upon it in fire".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 102:3
verses.text: Also in the Acts of the Apostles: "And suddenly there was made a sound from heaven, as if a vehement blast were borne along, and it filled the whole of that place in which they were sitting.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 102:4
verses.text: And there appeared to them cloven tongues as if of fire, which also settled upon each of them; and they were all filled with the Holy Ghost".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 102:5
verses.text: Also in the sacrifices, whatsoever God accounted accepted, fire descended from heaven, which consumed what was sacrificed.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 102:6
verses.text: In Exodus: "The angel of the Lord appeared in a flame of fire from the bush".

chapters.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 103

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 103:1
verses.text: That all good men ought willingly to hear rebuke.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 103:2
verses.text: In Solomon, in the Proverbs: "He who reproveth a wicked man shall be hated by him.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 103:3
verses.text: Rebuke a wise man, and he will love you".

chapters.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 104

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 104:1
verses.text: That we must abstain from much speaking.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 104:2
verses.text: In Solomon: "Out of much speaking thou shalt not escape sin; but sparing thy lips, thou shalt be wise".

chapters.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 105

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 105:1
verses.text: That we must not lie.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 105:2
verses.text: "Lying lips are an abomination to the Lord".

chapters.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 106

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 106:1
verses.text: That they are frequently to be corrected who do wrong in domestic duty.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 106:2
verses.text: In Solomon: "He who spareth the rod, hateth his son".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 106:3
verses.text: And again: "Do not cease from correcting the child".

chapters.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 107

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 107:1
verses.text: That when a wrong is received, patience is to be maintained, and vengeance to be left to God.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 107:2
verses.text: "Say not, I will avenge me of mine enemy; but wait for the Lord, that He may be thy help".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 107:3
verses.text: Also elsewhere: "To me belongeth vengeance; I will repay, saith the Lord".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 107:4
verses.text: Also in Zephaniah: "Wait on me, saith the Lord, in the day of my rising again to witness; because my judgment is to the congregations of the Gentiles, that I may take kings, and pour out upon them my anger".

chapters.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 108

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 108:1
verses.text: That we must not use detraction.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 108:2
verses.text: In Solomon, in the Proverbs: "Love not to detract, lest thou be taken away".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 108:3
verses.text: Also in the forty-ninth Psalm: "Thou sattest, and spakest against thy brother; and against the son of thy mother thou placedst a stumbling-block".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 108:4
verses.text: Also in the Epistle of Paul to the Colossians: "To speak ill of no man, nor to be litigious".

chapters.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 109

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 111:1

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 112:2

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 113:2

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 116:2

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 117:2

chapters.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 118

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 122:1
verses.text: Elucidations.

verses.text: I.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 122:3
verses.text: (On the unity of the Church, p.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 122:4
verses.text: )  The epistles have already been elucidated as the best exposition of this treatise.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 122:5
verses.text: Little need be added.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 122:6
verses.text: But, to illustrate the bearings of this treatise upon the history of Christian unity, we need only refer to the manner in which the subject was treated as soon as the papacy was created by Nicholas I.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 122:7
verses.text: Thus, he astounded the Greeks by his consummate audacity (a.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 122:8
verses.text: d.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 122:9
verses.text: ) in the matter of the disputed succession in Constantinople.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 122:10
verses.text: "It is our will," he says, "that Ignatius should appear before our envoys," etc.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 122:11
verses.text: He declares it the rule of the Fathers, that, "without the consent of the Roman See and the Roman pontiff, nothing should be decided".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 122:12
verses.text: Also, he affirms, "The Creator of all things has established the Princedom of the Divine Power, which He granted to His chosen apostles.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 122:13
verses.text: He has firmly established it on the firm faith of the Prince of the Apostles,that is to say, Peter,to whom he pre-eminently granted the first See," etc.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 122:14
verses.text: He was now speaking on the strength of the forged Decretals, to which he appeals, and which he succeeded in making law for the West.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 122:15
verses.text: He thus created the lasting schism with the Easterns, who had never heard the like before his time.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 122:16
verses.text: Obviously, therefore, had Cyprian entertained such ideas, his treatise could never have been written; for it is a masterly exposition of a curious point, viz.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 122:17
verses.text: , the fact that  the Apostle Peter received the first grant alone, and yet  all the apostles received precisely the same; while  Peter had thus a primacy of honour, but  in no respect any power or authority over his brethren.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 122:18
verses.text: On these admitted facts he constructs his theory of unity, expounding by it the actual state of the Church's constitution.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 122:19
verses.text: Peter's memory he honours, but without any less reverence for all the apostolic Sees, which over and over again he maintains to be of equal authority and sanctity.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 122:20
verses.text: That the Church was founded on Stephen any more than on the Bishop of Carthage, he never imagines; for it is one thing to allow that a bishop has succeeded an apostle at the place of his last labours, and quite another to assume that therefore such a bishop is virtually the apostle himself.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 122:21
verses.text: Yet this assumption is the ground of all Roman doctrine on this point.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 122:22
verses.text: Had such been Cyprian's idea, his Treatise on Unity must have proceeded thus:  "Our Lord said to Peter only, I will give unto thee the keys;  to the rest of the apostles He gave only an inferior and subject authority;  to the successor of Peter, therefore, at Rome, all other bishops and churches must be subject; for  in this subjection the law of unity consists; and  if even all the other apostles were alive to this day, they would be subject to Stephen, as Prince of the Apostles, or would be rebels against Christ".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 122:23
verses.text: Compare this treatise of Cyprian, then, with any authorized treatise on the subject proceeding from modern Rome, and it will be seen that the two systems are irreconcilable.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 122:24
verses.text: Thus, in few words, says the Confession of Pius IV.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 122:25
verses.text: : "I acknowledge the Holy Catholic Apostolic Roman Church for the mother and mistress of all churches; and I promise true obedience to the Bishop of Rome, successor to St.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 122:26
verses.text: Peter, Prince of the Apostles, and Vicar of Jesus Christ".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 122:27
verses.text: This is the voice of Italy in the ninth century; but Cyprian speaks for oecumenical Christendom in the third, and the two systems are as contrary as darkness and light.

verses.text: )  Cyprian is often innocently quoted by Romanist controvertists against the very principles of Cyprian himself, of his life and his writings.

Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 122:61
verses.text: )  The Jewish liturgies contained the petitions of the Lord's Prayer essentially; but our divine Lord framed this comprehensive and sublime compend, and gave it to His children for ever, with His own seal upon it in the exceptional petition which imparts to it the impress of His own cross and passion.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 122:62
verses.text: In the Gospel of St.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 122:63
verses.text: Matthew we find our Master commenting on the fifth petition in a very striking manner, as if it were the essence of the whole prayer; and, indeed, it is so, regarded as its evangelical feature, i-e:, something added to the law in the spirit of the Atonement.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 122:64
verses.text: As such, it surprised the apostles; and He who knew their thoughts instantly anticipated their inquiries: "For if ye forgive men," etc.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 122:65
verses.text: From the criticism of a very able editorial hand, I feel it a privilege to insert the following valuable comments:  "The petitions of the Lord's Prayer, as is well known, are to be found for the most part in the Talmud and Jewish liturgies.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 122:66
verses.text: In the latter we have frequently the phrases, 'our Father, our King,' 'our Father, Father of mercies,' and 'our Father that art in heaven.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 122:67
verses.text: '  The third petition in the Shemone esre is, 'Let us hallow the Name in the world as it is hallowed in the high heaven.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 122:68
verses.text: We will hallow Thee, and Thy praise, O God, shall not leave our mouth for ever and ever; since Thou, O God, art a great and holy King.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 122:69
verses.text: Praised be Thou, O Lord, thou holy God.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 122:70
verses.text: Thou art holy, and Thy name is holy, and holy men praise Thee everlastingly every day.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 122:71
verses.text: ' The ineffable name of God represented all His attributes, and is consequently frequently substituted for Him.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 122:72
verses.text: The end of the first petition in the Kaddish prayer runs thus:  'May He extend His kingdom in your days, and in those of the whole house of Israel very soon.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 122:73
verses.text: ' In Berakhoth ( b) we have, 'What is a short prayer? Rabbi Eliezer said, "Thy will be done in heaven, and peace of heart be unto those who fear Thee on earth".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 122:74
verses.text: ' The same tract gives another prayer: 'The needs of Thy people Israel are many, but its discernment is small.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 122:75
verses.text: Do Thou, O everlasting One, our God, give to each man what he needs for his support, and what his body wants; but do what seemeth Thee good.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 122:76
verses.text: ' In the Mekhilta we read that Rabbi Eliezer of Modin, near Jerusalem, said:  'Whosoever has enough for the day to eat, and says, What shall I eat to-morrow? is of little faith.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 122:77
verses.text: ' This passage seems to illustrate the meaning of the Greek .

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 122:78
verses.text: The third petition in the Shemone esre runs:  'Forgive us, O our Father, for we have sinned; forgive us, O our King, for we have transgressed: since Thou art He that forgiveth and pardoneth.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 122:79
verses.text: ' In reference to this the Midrash Shemoth (par.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 122:80
verses.text: ) states, 'There is no creature who does not owe thanks to the Lord; but He is pitiful and long-suffering, and remitteth old debts.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 122:81
verses.text: ' The daily morning prayer of the Jews contains this petition: 'Lead us not into the power of sin, of transgression and crime, of temptation and shame.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 122:82
verses.text: Let not passion have dominion over us, and keep us far from wicked men and evil company.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 122:83
verses.text: ' In one of the prayers composed in Aramaic for the rabbis and leading men of the Jewish community, the passage occurs, 'Defend and deliver them from all evil, and from all evil hap,' which may be compared with the petition, 'Deliver us from evil.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 122:84
verses.text: ' The Doxology at the end of the Lord's Prayer has equally Jewish parallels.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 122:85
verses.text: Thus, one of the daily evening prayers concludes with the words, 'For Thine is the kingdom;' i-e:, God alone is ruler of the world.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 122:90

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 122:95
verses.text: Little as I can approve of the magisterial air with which Dr.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 122:96
verses.text: Bunsen undertakes to decide all questions, and little as I sympathize with his abnormal religion, which seems to coincide with that of no existing church or sect in the world, I feel grateful for his industry in collecting materials, and am always interested in the ingenuity with which he works them into his theories.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 122:97
verses.text: Although he possesses some touchstone unknown to the rest of mankind, by which he reaches and utters pontifical decisions as to what is genuine and what is corrupt, I must record my doubts as to many of his facts, and my dissent from most of his inferences.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book III 122:98
